result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Conrad Kerntz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
60 Days to Pay.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson with certified law student May Lee   DF:  Brian Conrad Kerntz appeared. Case called at 1:49 p.m. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. May Lee gives recommendations of the joint agreement between the parties. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CM303. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM303. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- $250.00 fine including costs. Bond to apply. 60 days to pay.

- DNA sample and surcharge

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Brian Conrad Kerntz
Current: 209 11th Avenue Apt 201, Detroit Lakes, MN 56501 United States  (Effective: 06-18-2015)
Prior: 119 Graystone Plaza #201, Detroit Lakes, MN 56501 
per Defendant's bond. eif
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Super 8 Motel in New Richmond.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Francis D. Collins & Ryan Moertel,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,   DF:  Brian Conrad Kerntz appeared. Court confirms address. Defendant does not qualify for PD - PFAC.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Marco Gavenda  15R 006904. eif
